title: What is Generative AI?
description: An introduction to Generative AI and its core concepts.

items.title: What is AI?
items.content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is the field of technology where machines and systems are developed to perform tasks requiring human-like intelligence, like speech recognition, decision-making, and text generation.

items.title: What is Generative AI?
items.content: Generative AI (GenAI) is a subset of AI that focuses on creating new content, such as text, images, audio, and video, based on patterns it has learned from data.

items.title: Key Function of AI
items.question: Which of the following is a primary capability of Artificial Intelligence?
options: Performing tasks that require human-like intelligence.
Only storing large amounts of data.

items.title: Define Generative AI
items.question: In your own words, what is the main difference between general AI and Generative AI?
items.expectedAnswer: General AI performs tasks requiring intelligence, while Generative AI specifically focuses on creating new, original content like text or images based on what it has learned.

items.title: Real-World Example: Voice Assistants
items.content: Voice assistants like Siri, Alexa, and Google Assistant use AI to understand your voice commands and respond appropriately. This is an example of AI interpreting information.

items.title: Applying Generative AI
items.question: Name one example of a real-world Generative AI tool mentioned in the text and describe what it creates.
items.expectedAnswer: ChatGPT creates human-like text, DALL-E creates images from text descriptions, or GitHub Copilot creates code snippets.

items.title: Training Data's Role
items.question: Why is training data important for an AI to learn? Use the example of an AI learning to recognize animals.
items.expectedAnswer: Training data is key for AI to learn patterns. By showing an AI thousands of labeled pictures of animals (e.g., 'cat,' 'dog'), it learns to identify features like shape, size, and fur to make accurate predictions on new images.

items.title: Create a Prompt for an Image
items.taskDescription: You want to use a generative AI like DALL-E to create an image. Write a prompt to generate a picture of a futuristic city.
items.evaluationGuidance: 1. Does the prompt clearly state the subject (a futuristic city)? 2. Does it include at least two descriptive details (e.g., 'flying cars', 'gleaming skyscrapers', 'neon lights')? 3. Is the prompt concise and easy for an AI to understand?

items.title: Analyze a Flawed Prompt
items.taskDescription: A user gives a generative AI the prompt: 'Write a story.' This prompt is too vague. Identify why it is flawed and suggest an improved version that would lead to a better story.
items.evaluationGuidance: 1. Does the user correctly identify the flaw (vagueness)? 2. Does the suggested improvement add specific elements like genre, character, or plot? 3. Is the improved prompt clear and actionable for an AI?

items.title: Common Pitfalls
items.question: Based on the lesson, what is a common pitfall when interacting with AI, especially regarding its knowledge?
items.expectedAnswer: A common pitfall is assuming the AI has real-time knowledge. AI systems are trained on past data and don't know about recent events unless they are specifically designed to access the internet.

items.title: AI Learning Process
items.question: What is the correct four-step learning process for an AI?
options: Data Collection, Model Training, Evaluation and Tuning, Inference.

items.title: Summarize Deep Learning
items.question: Briefly summarize what Deep Learning is and what kind of structures it uses.
items.expectedAnswer: Deep learning is a subset of machine learning that uses neural networks with multiple layers (deep neural networks) to learn from complex data patterns. These layers allow the model to process information sequentially to make decisions.

items.title: Complex Prompt Creation
items.taskDescription: You are a teacher who wants to create a simple quiz about AI for your students. Write a prompt for a Generative AI that instructs it to act as a quiz creator. The prompt should specify the topic (Generative AI), the number of questions (3), the question format (multiple choice), and the target audience (middle school students).
items.evaluationGuidance: 1. Does the prompt clearly assign a role to the AI (quiz creator)? 2. Does it specify the topic, number of questions, and format? 3. Is the target audience clearly mentioned? 4. Is the prompt structured in a way that an AI can easily follow the instructions?
